references.paper_title: Sinkhorn distances: Lightspeed computation of optimal transport
references.reason: This paper introduced the entropic regularization of optimal transport, a cornerstone of many modern EOT solvers and a key focus of the current paper.
This is a foundational text on computational optimal transport that provides background and context for the techniques used in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Gradient flows: in metric spaces and in the space of probability measures
references.reason: This reference provides the theoretical foundation for understanding gradient flows in metric spaces, which is fundamental to the dynamic OT approach taken in the paper.

references.paper_title: Polar factorization and monotone rearrangement of vector-valued functions
references.reason: Brenier's theorem, a key result in optimal transport theory, is central to the understanding of Monge maps, which are a focus of this paper.

references.paper_title: Entropic estimation of optimal transport maps
references.reason: This paper established the statistical consistency of entropic maps for estimating optimal transport maps, a result directly relevant to the theoretical contributions of the current work.
